question: Which of the following acids is used in the lead storage cells?
explanation: Dilute sulfuric acid (H2SO4) serves as the electrolyte in a lead storage battery. The electrodes of the cells in a lead storage battery consist of lead grids. The openings of the anodic grid is filled with spongy (porous) lead. The openings of the cathodic grid is filled with lead dioxide (PBO2).
